questions.question:
Answer the questions given below (refer Fig.1):


Fig. 1. Circuit configuration of 3-Phase Uncontrolled Rectifier.


1. What is the function of a three-phase rectifier?

answers.a: To convert AC voltage to DC voltage
answers.b: To convert DC voltage to AC voltage
answers.c: To increase the input AC voltage magnitude
answers.d: To decrease the input AC voltage magnitude

explanations.a: Explanation 1: Rectifier converts the AC input voltage into DC output voltage.

questions.question: 2. The conduction angle of each diode in 3-phase uncontrolled bridge rectifier is:

explanations.c: Explanation 3: Each diode is forward biased for 120 degrees and hence it conducts in that duration.

questions.question: 3. What is the peak â€“to- peak ripple in DC output voltage of a 3-phase full-bridge uncontrolled rectifier?
4. What will be the effect of using highly resistive load in place of highly inductive load?

answers.a: Output DC voltage will be ripple free
answers.b: Output DC current will be pulsating in nature
answers.c: Output current will be AC in nature
answers.d: Output voltage will be AC in nature

explanations.b: Explanation 2: With resistive load the output current will be pulsating in nature.

questions.question: 5. Negative DC output voltage can easily be obtained by

answers.b: Change in the phase sequence of AC input voltage
answers.c: Reversing the diodes (D<sub>4</sub>, D<sub>6</sub> and D<sub>2</sub>) direction

explanations.d: Explanation 4: Reversing all six diodes direction.
